Design A hovercraft that can maintain a level sub 50 metre flight over Kerbal,using ground facing engines.

Must be able to both hover without momentum and hold steady.

My Attempt https://youtu.be/ozMz6SAPQKE
Must work without the MechJeb hold altitude feature?

My Second attempt Aleast i got off the ground https://youtu.be/6ibB_pAj5k8 ,and no you cant use the hold altitude feature.

Edited November 13, 2015 by MajorGosnell
Couldn't you just use SAS stabilization and tilt forward? That's what I use for VTOLs.
Tried SAS,it helps but maintaining directional thrust is very unstable.The Key is to find a balance between forward momentum and vertical stability.

Pretty much what they said above. You could look at CupecakeLander's creations. He (or she? don't know tbh) is quite amazing at making vtols and dropships.
i made one, with one wheesley at the bottom and 6 juno engine for the vtol, it's out of the rules or it's good?

Rules ar e loose,as long as it hovers its good.
